alert.note: Alert for Mason; Pendleton; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 4:49PM EDT until August 25 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, Bracken, Mason, Pendleton and Robertson. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 448 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Maysville, Falmouth, Lewisburg, Morgan, Mount Olivet, Sardis, Hittville, Santa Fe, Stonewall, Petra, Abigail, Powersville, Milford, Kentontown, Piqua, Mitchells Mill, Lowell and Burika.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
